sentence.text: We evaluated the association between dietary and supplenegative regulation of phosphatase activitytal zinc and prostate cancer within the VITamins And Lifestyle (VITAL) cohort, a study specifically designed to evaluate the negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II of dietary supplements and cancer risk.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Of 35,242 negative regulation of phosphatase activity who completed the baseline dietary and supplemental questionnaire, 832 men developed invasive prostate cancers between October 2000 and December 2004.

Ten-year average intake of supplenegative regulation of phosphatase activitytal zinc was not associated with a reduced prostate cancer risk overall (adjusted hazard ratio (HR) = 0.82 (95% confidence interval (CI) 0.58-1.14) for AAAA15 mg/day vs. nonuse, P for trend = 0.44); however, risk of advanced prostate cancer (regionally invasive or distant metastatic, n = 123) decreased with greater intake of supplemental zinc (adjusted HR = 0.34, 95% CI = 0.13-1.09 for 10-yr average intake AAAA 15 mg/day vs. nonuse, P for trend = 0.04).
